caption: The frozen birthday cake was pretty good. I bought it for an office birthday celebration and people loved it :)
Nice spot with good pastries.

Mariposa Baking Co does a great job of labeling allergens making it easy to select what you may want in more of a self-directed fashion.  They offer savory and sweet items, from bread to muffins to pupusas to sandwiches.  While they have …

Such a lovely little store in the San Francisco Bay Area. So many delicious looking (and tasting) gluten free products! We were overwhelmed at all the options but were so satisfied with everything we tried, you couldn’t really tell anything was GF!

This is for the Ferry Building kiosk and online interactions. Mariposa can be found on the south end of the Ferry Building. Seems they have limited stock of cakes as they sometimes sell out due to high demand, so I wasn’t sure if I could …
amazing !
A San Francisco gem. Anyone with celiac must come here. 100% gluten free. Delicious baked goods.
What can I say? You have to come and find yourself! Chocolate croissant is my fav.
Excellent gluten-free food but the service is painfully slow because of inefficient use of time by some staff... standing around waiting for a toaster to do it’s thing is a profit killer.

This is a MUST VISIT if you are gluten free! It had been so long since I've had a cinnamon roll...like years. I got one thinking I'd eat half now and the rest later since it was so big, but girl, I ate the entire thing in 5 seconds. SO AMAZING! This place is the best ever! Next time I'm in San Francisco, I'm stopping by for more!
Amazing gluten-free food. The Ginger snap cookies are so good. You cannot tell that anything here is gluten-free.
Ham and cheese pastry pocket prices went up and it was overcooked and dry and disappointing.
Friendly workers, great baked goods, really nice vegan + gluten free selection. Super fun stop in the Ferry Building! Try their toaster pastries :))
(Translated by Google) The chocolate cake is very tasty but the prices are high and unjustly  (Original) עוגת השוקולד טעימה מאוד אבל המחירים גבוהים ולא בצדק

The food is delicious so I go back a lot but sometimes they get my order wrong and I need to start checking the bag before I leave. They’ve put the wrong item in and today they left out two items I ordered and paid for, of course today in a …
The pain au chocolat is a major bummer.

This is the best 100% gluten free bakery that I have ever been to. They have almost everything: cinnamon rolls, muffins, turnovers, cupcakes, cheese cakes, lasagna, garlic bread, pizza crusts, ravioli, pretzels, biscotti, croissants, and …
AMAZING. I've been on a gluten free diet for almost two years, and I have missed bagels soooo much. Also try the pain au chocolat. I wish I had one of these in my home state.

Oh my goodness... where do i start? Traveling gluten free can be a challenge, and finding something sweet can be even more difficult. I found Mariposa's through a google online gluten free search and I am so glad I did. Everything is made …

Absolute heaven! Incredible gluten and dairy free baking. Whenever I travel I am looking for good gluten free options, and this place was above most bakeries. Couldn’t even tell any of their items were GF. Breakfast bagels are SO worth it. …
Delicious - gf df Cinnabon ! I’d fly back to SF just for this!
Underwhelming and way overpriced. I just had the Cherry Turnover. The filling was minimal and the crust chewy and soft instead of flaky. At $6.25 it was way overpriced and not memorable.
Unmatched variety for Gluten-free folk. But, very expensive.
Fully gluten free.
I've died and gone to gluten free heaven!!! 🤣🤣🤣🤣 Had the warmed veggie pocket and it was so good.

If you have gluten issues & are in the SF Bay Area, you have to go to Mariposa! Pretty much everything I've gotten here has been great. I prefer the Oakland location because there's a whole cafe space to sit and eat, but the food is the same at both locations.

(Translated by Google) Yum yum Must go to the covered market of Embarcadero ... the pastries are super good ...  (Original) Miam miam. Passage obligé au marché couvert d' Embarcadero ... les pâtisseries sont super bonnes...

This is the best place in the area for gluten-free food. Their dinner rolls, sandwich rolls, croissants and veggie pockets are absolutely to die for. So good. The cheesecake and cinnamon rolls are my favorite sweets. I have their wonderful …
Blown away by their vegan cupcake. Their open face avocado sandwich was unreal. A nice selection of baked goods, cookies and cupcakes as well as salads and sandwiches. Delicious!
Soo yum, couldn't believe it was gf. They have  a wide selection of baked goods and their puff pastries are so delicious!!
Absolutely delicious! Finally a gluten free croissant and it’s really good!

This was my 2nd time going there and it was still amazing. The 1st time I went I cried cuz I was so happy to finally see a place that was all gluten free. I'm not from San Francisco and where I live it's hard to find places that are just …
So so delicious!!
Delicious
Love their chocolate muffins
Horrible, doughy and nothing flakey about the croissant
The best Gluten free bakery on earth

Let me preface this by stating that I haven’t eaten a croissant in 6 years.To ease the guilt of consuming as many gf baked-goods as possible in a short period of time, I ran to the ferry building to allow for guilt-free calorie consumption. …

A celiacs dream!! So many options for gluten free pastries, treats, and sandwiches. It’s impossible to pick just one thing to try. The cinnamon bun, soft pretzel and cherry custard danish were my top picks! Thank you mariposa!!
Great gluten free baked goods!  The pastries were light and fluffy. Definitely noteworthy and worth giving a try!

YES! We recently visited San Fran and happened upon this bakery and I was overjoyed to see how many dairy-free treats they had! (Thanks, Mariposa for doing a stellar job with your labeling!) My husband treated me to a package of their pecan …
Love their gluten free baguette... Really want to try their steak sandwich on next visit
The item I bought was very very good. Some of the options were very expensive.

A dream come true for any person on a GF diet. Lots of gf options and all really yummy (all the bakery goodies are gf!). Loved the creamy danish and their California sandwich. Also people working there are really nice and helpful. Been in SF 4 days, I've been there 3 times :)
I had donuts and muffin after a really long time and they were delicious .
Best gluten free sandwiches / deserts we have had anywhere. Came back every day for our visit. If your gluten free you must visit!

My absolute dream come true. I highly recommend the croissant, because it’s something no other gluten free bakery has been able to accomplish. I just fill a box of whatever looks great that day and I’m always impressed! Service is so nice. …

I’m just in love with this bakery. A whole bakery of gluten free goodies. As someone who usually has to skip dessert, this was a nice surprise to find not only gluten free treats but an entire bakery dedicated to it. The only negative is that they are quite sweet so I’m sure a lot of sugar is used.

I spent my week in San Fran staying near the Ferry building so I went here more than once. I got a ham and cheese pocket, a bear claw and a couple of the plum and blueberry poptarts. The poptarts, and the ham and cheese pocket were …
Wow I was blown away with the egg and bacon breakfast sandwiches. Definitely recommend this place.👍👌

Updated December 2017 - Do not order the avocado toast, it’s awful! Hardly any avocado, the bread feels stale and just slapped a cucumber and tomato on top. Go next door to Frog Hollow, much better food and service! Previous visit- This …
Ordered a ham and cheese croissant and a mini cupcake = $9. Charged my card for $12 🙁

This place is gluten free heaven. The prices are really high, but for the steep price you get one of the best gluten free bakery products there is. Came here two times when we were visiting the town and each time was better than anything before this place.
(Translated by Google) Fantastic, all absolutely gluten free.  (Original) Fantastico, tutto assolutamente gluten free.

(Translated by Google) Breads, croissants, pains au chocolat, apple turnovers, muffins, sandwiches, cakes, ... all gluten-free. And what's more, it's good!  (Original) Pains, croissants, pains au chocolat, chaussons aux pommes, muffins, sandwiches, gateaux,... le tout sans gluten. Et en plus c'est bon !

Finally a place where I could pick whatever I want on the menu! Being that I have celiac disease I do not go to bakery's and have the option to order a delicious loaf of warm bread! Or even freshly baked double chocolate cookies! I even was …

For the wife who has Celiac's, this place is a godsend. After watching me stuff my face with sourdough, she finally was able to pick literally anything she wanted from here since it's all gluten-free. She's now fully stocked and already …

Great gluten free savoury and sweet options. Rolls are soft and juicy, cakes and cinnamon buns a definite treat for coeliacs and non-coeliacs alike.  Only reason not for five stars is the price, with no real bulk discounts offered if you're stocking up with fresh and frozen products.

The best gluten free croissant on either coast!  While visiting San Francisco found this gem of a place and could not get enough of the delicious dedicated gluten free options. Taste tested and approved by non-celiacs! That's says volumed about how great the food is. Prices are extremely reasonable.
Fantastic food! It is really the best gluten free for I have had.
Gluten free friendly.

This rating is an average of food (5 stars) and service (.5 stars). I have celiac disease, so this place is my go-to for baked goods. Delicious, great variety, and completely safe for those of us who get sick from gluten. The service on the …

Fantasticly stumbled upon this treasure for breakfast on our first day in San Fran. The cinnamon bun was awesome and my daughter enjoyed the pop tart very much! It was so delicious I was worried with my allergies it wasn't in fact gluten and dairy free! Will be back daily while in town!
Great gluten free items but rude service
Omg, their stuff is SO SO good. I can't stand gluten free bread from the supermarket any more. I LOVE bread from Mariposa. It's addictive. Highly recommended!!
Best gluten free ham and cheese croissant on the planet!
The Mariposa Bakery at the ferry building is the hotspot for gluten free and diary free in San Francisco. An absolute Must Have! Try it, join it, love it.
Amazing selection of dairy and gluten free baked goods in a gluten free only kiosk. I believe everything is made in a gluten free kitchen.
Their gluten-free goods are amazing. So many options! Pain au chocolat, donuts, bagels, etc. etc. Heaven for everyone with celiac disease :)
Cinnamon rolls were ok but the cookies were great!
I like having a dedicated GF place in the Ferry Building.  They use a ton of xanthan gum, so go easy if you get gummy tummy.
Finally got down to the wharf to try this place out and it didn't disappoint! Favorites include their baguettes, croissants, and cinnamon buns.
Cute little bakery, expensive but delicious

(Translated by Google) Ingenious bakery with exclusively gluten-free products (croissants, chocolate croissants, quiches, biscuits, bread rolls, etc.); our daughter suffers from celiac disease and found the baked goods "fantastic" - she …
A fantastic bakery! The amount of gluten free and casein free options here are just amazing for anyone that has food allergies. The price here is a little steep but the quality they output is 👌👌👌
The bakery makes wonderful goods, but their customer service is awful. Don't rely on them for birthdays or events, they may not make their deadline. Ruined my day today.
No nut variety pastries. My son did not like it. It's not for everyone but the quality is there.
Lots of great baked goods here!

Really good gluten-free bakery. Personally, I much prefer their breads and bagels to their sweets. They also have a nice selection of lunch sandwiches. If you're looking for a great, healthy, and tasty lunch, then this is a great choice. For the sweets, head over to Frog & Hollow, and get a coffee from Blue Bottle - you're set.
Gluten-free heaven!  If you come early in the morning, you can sometimes score deals on yesterday's leftovers.
Hard-to-find variety of fresh gluten free baked goods.

This is a gold mine for anyone you know who needs gluten free. They have yummy pastries, sandwiches, and tons of items you can't often find gluten free. I had a quiche that was delicious. It's a fun stop if you're heading to the farmer's …

So happy Mariposa moved into the Ferry Building!  This is my haven for gluten-free foods during the workday and to bring home for dinner.  They have these delicious little meat sandwiches that make for a great quick lunch.  They also supply …
